cves.description: The Blog2Social: Social Media Auto Post & Scheduler plugin for WordPress is vulnerable to Server-Side Request Forgery in all versions up to, and including, 8.6.0 via the getFullContent() function. This makes it possible for authenticated attackers, with Subscriber-level access and above, to make web requests to arbitrary locations originating from the web application and can be used to query and modify information from internal services.

affected.product: Blog2Social: Social Media Auto Post & Scheduler

cves.description:
A improper restriction of operations within the bounds of a memory buffer exists in AsIO3.sys driver. This vulnerability can be triggered by manually executing a specially crafted process, potentially leading to local privilage escalation.
For additional information, please refer to the 'Security Update for Armoury Crate App' section of the ASUS Security Advisory.
problemType: CWE-119 Improper Restriction of Operations within the Bounds of a Memory Buffer
